title: Ward, Lack push each other in goal
text:
Ward, Lack push each other in goal 
Posted 6:42 p.m. today Your friends e-mail addresses (comma separated): * Subject: * You must enter the characters with black color that stand out from the other characters More on this NHL players to watch: Ovechkin, Crosby, Kane, Stamkos, Price 
Peters: On October 8th, Wardo's gonna start 
Raleigh, N.C. â€” Too much of a good thing? There's no such thing when it comes to NHL goaltending. Barring one anomaly in Pittsburgh, Carolina Hurricanes head coach Bill Peters witnessed some stellar preseason netminding capped off by mainstay Cam Ward's 35-save finale. "Wardo, to me, since I've been here, has been very, very good," Peters said. 
Then there's offseason acquisition Eddie Lack, who surrendered just five goals in three games while turning away 67 shots. 
"Eddie's been excellent in the room. He has an excellent work ethic," Peters said. 
Neither goalie shrinks from the competition in the locker room or on the ice. 
Lack wears a picture of his former Vancouver teammate, starting goaltender Roberto Luongo, on his helmet. Sharing time between the pipes is nothing new to him. 
"It's kind of like what I feel like I've been having the last couple of years with (Roberto) Luongo and (Ryan) Miller. The better goalie is going to play, but we can still push each other on and off the ice," Lack said. 
Peters likes that vibe. 
"It's gonna get competitive. It's going to be a very, very competitive environment from within for ice time and roles on our team, so when you win, as a coach, I like to reward the guy, the goaltender and put him right back in," he said. 
With the regular season set to start on Thursday, the hot hand rests in the left glove of the 11-year vet from Saskatoon. "I'll tell you right now, we play on the 8th, and it'll be Wardo. And I'll just go from there," Peters said. 
Depending on the opponent, the schedule and performance, that strategy may change. But Ward is once again the go-to guy in goal for Carolina as a new season begins. Credits
